AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Moore, Texas: location near the border, approximately 115 miles from the Mexican border, and a point through which Interstate Highway 35 passes before reaching the United States-Mexican border, also a common location for apprehending illegal alien smugglers
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Interstate Highway 35: highway where the stop occurred, commonly used for smuggling of aliens, and known for its reputation as a common smuggling route
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Mexican border: reference point for the location of the stop, 115 miles south of where the pickup truck was stopped
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.truck cab: front part of the truck where passengers were seated and where a flashlight was shone
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.back seat of the truck: rear part of the truck cab where passengers were seated and attempting to conceal themselves, also referred to as the back seat or the seat in this context
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.floor of the camper: area where fourteen additional males were found lying down
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.pickup truck camper: compartment of the vehicle where evidence was found and is relevant to the suppression motion, often used for transporting illegal aliens
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Laredo, Texas: city located on Interstate Highway 35, leading directly to the Mexican border, and a point of reference for determining distance from the border
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States-Mexican border: geographical boundary between the United States and Mexico, relevant to the case and the Brignoni-Ponce test
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.northbound lanes of Interstate Highway 3: specific segment of the highway with known alien smuggling activity
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Court of Appeals for the F: federal court that reviews cases related to border patrol stops
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.pickup truck: vehicle stopped on an Interstate Highway in Texas, containing a heavily loaded camper attachment, also referred to as the vehicle in this context
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States district court: federal court that made the original judgment in the case
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Texas: location where the pickup truck was stopped, approximately 115 miles north of the Mexican border
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Interstate Highway: highways where stops by border patrol agents may occur, subject to constitutional protections against unreasonable searches
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.front seat of the truck cab: part of the truck where three women were seated
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Mexico: country of origin for illegal migrants
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.interior of the pickup truck: area inside the vehicle where occupants were trying to hide, also referred to as the dark cabin
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Maria De Jesus Garcia: owner of the vehicle involved in the case, a camper
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.area behind the front seat of the truck: space where passengers were moving and slouching low to get out of the light
